sys::Link Class Reference

Documentation

This class is used to access devices running Stratify OS from a desktop C++ application.

This class is not available on native Stratify OS applications.

This closes an open directory.

Parameters
dirpThe directory to close
static var::String sys::Link::convert_permissions ( link_mode_t  mode)
static

This methods converts the permissions to a string of the format:

-rwxrwxrwx

The first character indicates:

  • - File
  • d Directory
  • c Character file
  • b Block file

The order is other, group, user. If the permission is not available, the character is replace by a "-".

int sys::Link::copy ( const var::String &  src,
const var::String &  dest,
link_mode_t  mode,
bool  to_device = true,
bool(*)(void *, int, int)  update = 0,
void *  context = 0 
)

This copies a file either from the device to the host or from the host to the device depending on the value of toDevice.

Returns
Zero on success
Parameters
srcThe path to the source file
destThe path to the destination file
modeThe access permissions if copying to the device
to_deviceWhen true, copy is from host to device

int sys::Link::exit ( )

This disconnects from the device. After calling this, other applications can access the device.

int sys::Link::init ( const var::String &  path,
const var::String &  sn,
bool  is_legacy = false 
)

This connects to the specified Stratify OS device. After calling this, other applications will not have access to the device.

Parameters
pathThe path to the serial device
snThe serial number or an empty string to ignore

This method will install a binary to the specified location

Parameters
sourceThe source of the binary file
destThe location to install the file (directory)
updateA callback to update the caller on the progress of the install
contextFirst argument passed to update
Returns
Zero on success or -1 with error() set to an appropriate message
int sys::Link::ioctl ( int  fd,
int  request,
void *  ctl = NULL 
)

This performs IO ctl on an open file descriptor. fd must refer to a device rather than a regular file. ctl must be unionized with a link_bulk_t, for example:

union {
adc_attr_t attr;
link_bulk_t buf;
} adc;
adc.attr.freq = 200000;
adc.attr.enabled_channels = 0x0F;
adc.attr.pin_assign = 0;
dev.ioctl(fd, I_SETATTR, &adc);
Returns
Number of bytes read or less than zero on failure
bool sys::Link::is_bootloader ( ) const
inline

This checks to see if the target is in bootloader mode.

Returns
Non zero if bootloader mode is active.
bool sys::Link::is_connected ( ) const

This checks to see if the device is connected.

Returns
true if connected

int  flags,
link_mode_t  mode = 0 
)

This opens a file (or device such as /dev/adc0) on the target device.

Returns
The file descriptor on success or -1 on failure
Parameters
fileThe name of the file to open
flagsThe access flags such as LINK_O_RDWR
modeThe access permissions when creating a new file

This function reads an entry from an open directory.

int sys::Link::reset ( )

This function resets the device (connection will be terminated)

Returns
Zero on success or less than zero on error
int sys::Link::reset_bootloader ( )

This function resets the device and invokes the DFU bootloader. The connection to the device is terminated with this call.

Returns
Zero on success or less than zero on error
int sys::Link::rmdir ( const var::String &  directory)

This removes a directory on the target device.

Parameters
directoryThe directory name (must be empty)
int sys::Link::run_app ( const var::String &  path)

This runs an application on the device.

Returns
The PID of the new process or less than zero for an error

inline

Return the serial number of the last device that was connected (including the currently connected device)

A string containing the serial number of the last connected (or currently connected) device

struct link_stat *  st 
)

This function reads the file statistics on the specified target device file.

inline

This gets the status of the current operation in progress.

int sys::Link::symlink ( const var::String &  oldPath,
const var::String &  newPath 
)

This creates a symbolic link on the device.

Note
Stratify OS does not currently support symbolic links. This function will always return an error.
Returns
Zero on sucess.
Parameters
oldPathThe existing path
newPathThe path to the new link
int sys::Link::unlink ( const var::String &  filename)

This deletes a file on the target device.

Parameters
filenameThe filename to delete
int sys::Link::update_binary_install_options ( const var::String &  path,
const var::String &  name,
const var::String &  id,
int  version,
bool  startup,
bool  run_in_ram,
int  ram_size 
)

details This method will update a binary app with the specified settings

Parameters
pathFull path to the binary file
nameThe name that should be assigned to the app
startupTrue if app should run at startup
run_in_ramTrue if app should run in ram
ram_sizeNumber of bytes the app needs for RAM (excluding code if run_in_ram is true)
Returns
Zero on success or -1 with error() set to an appropriate message
